Docs.summary: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between PointF values.

remarks.para: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between PointF values.

Docs.summary: Construct a PointFEvaluator that returns a new PointF on every evaluate call.

remarks.para: Construct a PointFEvaluator that returns a new PointF on every evaluate call. To avoid creating an object for each evaluate call, should be used whenever possible.

Docs.summary: Constructs a PointFEvaluator that modifies and returns reuse in calls.

remarks.para: Constructs a PointFEvaluator that modifies and returns reuse in calls. The value returned from should not be cached because it will change over time as the object is reused on each call.

MemberSignature.Value: Java.Lang.Object ITypeEvaluator.Evaluate (float fraction, Java.Lang.Object startValue, Java.Lang.Object endValue);

.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.Object Android.Animation.ITypeEvaluator.Evaluate(float32 fraction, class Java.Lang.Object startValue, class Java.Lang.Object endValue) cil managed
public virtual Android.Graphics.PointF Evaluate (float fraction, Android.Graphics.PointF startValue, Android.Graphics.PointF endValue);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.PointF Evaluate(float32 fraction, class Android.Graphics.PointF startValue, class Android.Graphics.PointF endValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
Docs.summary: This function returns the result of linearly interpolating the start and end PointF values, with fraction representing the proportion between the start and end values.

remarks.para: This function returns the result of linearly interpolating the start and end PointF values, with fraction representing the proportion between the start and end values. The calculation is a simple parametric calculation on each of the separate components in the PointF objects (x, y).
If was used to construct this PointFEvaluator, the object returned will be the reuse passed into the constructor.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
